title: Processes - Diff Eq Separation of Variables

content.question: Which of the following is the solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, minus 2, equals, negative y " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="y of 0, equals, negative 3 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, negative 1, minus 2 times the square root of t plus 1, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the negative of e raised to the negative t power, minus 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y equals, 2 minus 5 times e raised to the negative t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y equals, 2 minus 5 times e raised to the t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, 2 minus 5 times e raised to the negative t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
